text: Michel Blanc (16 April 1952 â€“ 3 October 2024) was a French actor, screenwriter and director. He was known for his leading role in the 1989 crime drama Monsieur Hire. Blanc is one of the few people to have won awards at the Cannes Film Festival in both a creative and performing role, winning the Male Acting Prize in 1986 and the Best Screenplay Prize in 1994. Blanc was born in Courbevoie, France. Blanc died at hospital in Paris, France from a heart attack on 3 October 2024, at the age of 72. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1952 births Category:2024 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:French movie actors Category:French television actors Category:French stage actors Category:French movie directors Category:French screenwriters Category:People from Courbevoie
title: Michel Blanc
